answers.answer: Hello, Lynn.  I'm not a medical professional, just the parent of a kid with diabetes.  Low energy and leg cramps are symptoms of high blood sugars.  I'm not as familiar with the menstrual cycles (my daughter's only 10 so we haven't hit that stage yet), so I'm not sure about that part.  It's entirely possible that her body is simply adjusting to being back to normal blood sugars.  If those symptoms continue for too much longer, I'd definitely report it to her endo.

question: My daughter has been diabetic for 15 years.  For the past two years her control has not been good. She has recently started to control it much better and glucose levels are near normal. She has been feeling less energetic since her sugars have come down. She started having leg cramps and her skin is real tender to the touch on her ankles. This has been happening for the past 3 weeks  She has also had period problems. She went to the gynocoligist last week.  She has been without a peroid for a long time and so they put her on birth control pills to regulate this. Could these problems be due to better blood sugar control after being so out of control for so long?
title: Don't know whats wrong
